RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Licenciatura em Química pela Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (2003), mestrado em Físico-Química pela Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (2005) e doutorado em Química de Produtos Naturais pela Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (2011). Doutorado sanduíche no México (Centro de Investigación y de Estudios Avanzados del Instituto Politécnico). Experiência na área de Química, com ênfase em Química Teórica e síntese de produtos naturais e análogos, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: Cálculos ab initio e modelagem molecular, com ênfase no cálculo de propriedades espectroscópicas, estrutura eletrônica, esteroquímica e propriedades fisico-químicas de produtos naturais. Fez pós-doutorado em síntese orgânica na Universidade Federal Fluminense (2011-2012). Atualmente é professor de Química na Universidade Federal de Jataí, estando vinculado também aos Programas de Pós-Graduação em Ciências Aplicadas à Saúde (PPGCAS) e Pós-Graduação em Química (PGQ) da Universidade Federal de Jataí. Coordenador da CAPE-UFJ (coordenação de ações pedagógicas especiais) de 2022-2024
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Bachelor's degree in Chemistry from the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (2003), a Master's Degree in Physics and Chemistry from the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (2005) and a PhD in Chemistry of Natural Products from the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (2011). Doctorate sandwich in Mexico (Center of Research and Advanced Studies of the Polytechnic Institute). Post-doctorate at the Fluminense Federal University (2012) working on organic synthesis of chalcones. Experience in the field of Chemistry, with emphasis in Theoretical Chemistry and synthesis of natural and analogous products, working mainly in the following subjects: Ab initio calculations and molecular modeling, with emphasis on the calculation of spectroscopic properties, electronic structure and properties of natural products. Actually his rechearch is focusing on NMR-GIAO chemical shifcts calculations of organic molecules. He is currently a Professor of Chemistry at the Federal University of Goiás, Jataí Regional, and is also a member of the Postgraduate Program in Applied Health Sciences (PPGCAS).

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Ensino na perspectiva da Educação Inclusiva
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Esta linha se foca em uma abordagem teórico-prática para estruturar o trabalho do futuro docente, integrando práticas pedagógicas que facilitam a inclusão de alunos com deficiência no ambiente escolar. Estuda as ferramentas e estratégias essenciais para essa inclusão, conectando teoria e prática, conteúdo e método, além de fortalecer a relação entre professor, aluno e conhecimento. A ênfase na diversidade busca promover um ambiente educacional inclusivo e acolhedor, adaptando práticas pedagógicas às necessidades individuais dos alunos e garantindo igualdade de oportunidades de aprendizado e desenvolvimento.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Cálculos teóricos de estrutura eletrônica e de propriedades espectroscópicas de moléculas orgânicas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto tem como objetivo o uso da modelagem molecular como ferramenta auxiliar aos químicos experimentalistas no que tange à determinação da estrutura e na racionalização das propriedades físico-química de moléculas orgânicas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The research line is focused on the study of physical-chemical properties of organic molecules and their electronic structure. It uses ab initio and DFT calculations, mainly the last one as implemented in Gaussian suite of programs for Linux systems. In the research we use, for conformational analysis Monte Carlo stochastic simulations. Another aspect is the study of the spectroscopic properties of organic molecules. In this aspect the research line involves the simulation of infra-red (IR), ultraviolet and visible (UV-VIS) and NMR spectroscopy. In NMR, we studied linear regression-based calculation protocols aiming at better reproduction and prediction of experimental chemical shift
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Theoretical calculations of electronic structure and spectroscopic properties of organic molecules

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Métodos computacionais aplicados à divulgação de física
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Este projeto consiste na criação de modelos didáticos utilizando recursos computacionais objetivando a divulgação de Física. O público alvo são alunos de Ensino Médio na cidade de Jataí. Os recursos computacionais consistem de algoritmos implementados em Python e outras linguagens para obtenção de figuras, gráficos, animações e simulações que descrevam e expliquem problemas físicos de interesse de maneira clara e intuitiva. Além disso, todos os recursos computacionais desenvolvidos serão disponibilizados on line para os alunos e quaisquer outros interessados, para que eles mesmos possam executar os programas, alterando os valores, e gerar seus próprios resultados. Além do texto que descreve o fenômeno físico, utilizando os resultados dos algoritmos, faremos também um texto explicando como utilizar os recursos computacionais desenvolvidos. Tal trabalho será desenvolvido pelo professor proponente e colaboradores (professores e alunos) da instituição.

Este projeto não solicita financiamento da Universidade Federal de Goiás e não tem nenhum tipo de financiamento de nenhuma outra agência.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Simulações fora do equilíbrio no sistema de discos em duas dimensões usando Monte Carlo com Cadeia de Eventos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
IBIC está trabalhando nele. Este projeto cadastrado no ano de 2017 (já que o plano de trabalho do atual bolsista PIBIC refere-se a um projeto cadastrado em 2016) descreve melhor e em mais detalhes os conceitos e objetivos deste trabalho do que o projeto cadastrado em 2016. Este projeto também servirá de base para a solicitação de bolsa de iniciação.
A ideia geral o projeto é o estudo do sistema de discos em duas dimensões através do desenvolvimento de algoritmos que implementa a dinâmica temporal de Monte Carlo por Cadeia de Eventos. Além disso, este sistema tem sido alvo de muitas publicações de impacto [Ber11,Deu14,Kap15,Kom15,Str88]. Estes dois fatores mostram que o estudo deste sistema é um tema de grande interesse atualmente. O diferencial do projeto é o estudo desse sistema fora do equilíbrio, usando simulação antes de chegar no equilíbrio.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Prospecção in sílico de compostos bioativos contra cândida utilizando ancoragem e dinâmica molecular, modelos de previsão de atividade biológica, cálculos de propriedades físico-químicas e espectroscópicas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O gênero Cândida possui cerca de 200 espécies, das quais vinte são mais frequentemente isoladas durante a infecção, como C. albicans e Cândida não albicans (por exemplo, C. tropicalis, C. glabrata, C. parapsilosis, C. krusei, C. guilliermondii , e outros). O presente projeto tem como objetivos avaliar o potencial de produtos naturais ou não, usar recolocação de fármacos e propor novos compostos como inibidores dos vários gêneros da Cândida por meio de cálculos computacionais de docking, dinâmica molecular, estudos da relação quantitativa estrutura-atividade, combinação entre mecânica-quântica e mecânica molecular. As proteínas alvo são as proteases aspárticas secretadas para Candida, adesinas em Candida spp e Erg11p mutante e selvagem. De tal modo, a busca de novos inibidores, sobretudo graças à resistência a certos medicamentos existente e a seus que efeitos colaterais é de extrema importância. Assim, espera-se com este projeto contribuir para possíveis inovações terapêuticas.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Impacto do Design Universal para Aprendizagem no Ensino Fundamental II, Ensino Médio e Superior: Acessibilidade, Engajamento e Desempenho Acadêmico em Ciências, Química, Física, Matemática e Biologia
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O presente projeto de pesquisa visa analisar o impacto da implementação do Desenho Universal para Aprendizagem (DUA) em turmas do ensinofundamental II, ensino médio e superior. O objetivo geral é avaliar os indicadores de acessibilidade, engajamento e desempenho acadêmico dosestudantes nas disciplinas de ciências, química, física, matemática e biologia. Os objetivos específicos incluem verificar se a adoção de práticasalinhadas ao DUA aumenta a acessibilidade dos materiais didáticos, investigar se a implementação do DUA promove maior engajamento emotivação dos estudantes, analisar os resultados escolares de turmas com e sem aplicação do DUA, identificar relações entre a implementaçãodo DUA e o desempenho acadêmico dos alunos, e propor materiais didáticos alternativos com base nos princípios do DUA. A metodologia envolve uma pesquisa aplicada, com abordagem quantitativa e objetivo descritivo-explicativo. Inclui a revisão bibliográfica, seleção de turmas, capacitação de professores, desenvolvimento de materiais didáticos, implementação do DUA, coleta de dados, análise de dados e disseminação dos resultados. Os resultados esperados incluem aumento da acessibilidade, maior engajamento discente, melhor aprendizagem, maior inclusão e melhoria do desempenho acadêmico dos discentes

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Application of the equivalent-core calculation to the Cl in core level on condensed SiCl4
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Application of the equivalent-core calculation to the Cl in core level on condensed SiCl4

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Utilization of the equivalent core may be of great help in the determination of excitation energies for condensed systems. This method presents a small difference in the excitation potential in relation to the experimental values, thus, enabling a better symmetry assignment for the excitations involved in the process. With the help of (Z+1)-core model, we estimated the absorption position and the symmetry for the discrete core-excitation state of the Cl K edge on SiCl4 and were able to understand the process of selective fragmentation for condensed systems with good calculation approximation.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: (?)-epi-Presilphiperfolan-1-ol, a new triquinane sesquiterpene from the essential oil of Anemia tomentosa var. anthriscifolia (Pteridophyta)
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: (?)-epi-Presilphiperfolan-1-ol, a new triquinane sesquiterpene from the essential oil of Anemia tomentosa var. anthriscifolia (Pteridophyta)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: (−)-epi-Presilphiperfolan-1-ol, (1), a new triquinane sesquiterpene, was isolated from the essential oil of Anemia tomentosa var. anthriscifolia by column chromatography. Its structure elucidation was accomplished by extensive 1D- and 2D-NMR analyses, as well as by GC?MS, chiral bidimensional GC, dehydration reactions, and a comparative (GIAO/DFT) theoretical study of the 13C NMR chemical shifts of 1 and its known isomers (presilphiperfolan-1-ol (1a), presilphiperfolan-8-ol (3), and presilphiperfolan-9-ol (4)).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A Dynamic Molecular Study of Parallel Gold Nanowires Matrix
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: A Dynamic Molecular Study of Parallel Gold Nanowires Matrix

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We study the theoretical van der Waals interaction of parallel gold nanowires (GNs) in matrix form with free extremities using molecular mechanics. It was calculated force, velocity, efficiency, thermodynamics properties like molar heat capacity, molar entropy variation and the relation between kinetic energy and temperature in situ of the GNs. We found new information about the nanowire behavior due to the matrix form. Each nanowire has 20 atoms and distant 27.78 angstroms from each one.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Structure reassignment and absolute configuration of 9-epi-presilphiperfolan-1-ol
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Structure reassignment and absolute configuration of 9-epi-presilphiperfolan-1-ol

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Reevaluation of 13C NMR data in combination with X-ray diffraction and VCD studies led us to reassign the structure of (−)-epi-presilphiperfolan-1-ol (1), isolated from Anemia tomentosavar.anthriscifolia, to (−)-9-epi-presilphiperfolan-1-ol (2) and to establish its absolute configuration as 1S,4S,7R,8R,9S.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: GIAO-HDFT scaling factor for 13C NMR chemical shifts calculation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: GIAO-HDFT scaling factor for 13C NMR chemical shifts calculation

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this paper, we present a GIAO-HDFT scaling factor study, in which we intent to investigate the ability of GIAO-HDFT/cc-pVDZ to achieve a high cost-effectiveness ratio. A set of 22 small molecules providing 27 different 13C chemical shifts determined in the gas phase was used. Geometry optimizations were performed for a single molecule in a gas phase using B3LYP/cc-pVDZ, B3LYP/aug-cc-pVDZ, B3PW91/cc-pVDZ and B3PW91/aug-cc-pVDZ level of theory. NMR chemical shifts were computed at the B3LYP and B3PW91 with cc-pVnZ (n = 2?3) and augment aug-cc-pVnZ (n = 2?3) levels using the GIAO method and are given relative to that of TMS calculated at the same level of theory. Despite the calculation approximations the chemical shifts calculated at the B3PW91/cc-pVDZ//B3PW91/cc-pVDZ using a simple relationship (δscalc = 1.02 δcalc − 0.92, where δcalc and δscalc are the calculated and the linearly scaled values of the 13C chemical shifts, respectively) were able to yield MAD and RMS errors as small as those obtained with other GIAO-HDFT (B3LYP, B3PW91 and OPBE) with bigger basis sets, such as 6-311 + G(2d,p) and cc-pVTZ. The used approach also proved successful in distinguishing regioisomers, but, unfortunately, it lacks the ability to distinguish between diastereoisomers, a task otherwise proved to be very difficult to accomplish.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Theoretical Study on Styrenes Planarity: Styrene and p-Hydroxi-Styrene
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Theoretical Study on Styrenes Planarity: Styrene and p-Hydroxi-Styrene

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: With a great deal of future promise for potential applications as high-performance materials and maybe to become the most versatile industrial advanced materials, polymer nanocomposites are a important new class of materials. It is well known that small changes in the structure of the monomer present great affect in the proprieties of the corresponding polymer, so the correct description of the monomer structure plays an important role in the planning of a polymer nanocomposite. We focus our attention on styrene the monomer of polystyrene. Styrene's physical?chemical properties are the subject of many theoretical and experimental papers, as is the question of its possible planarity. In this paper we present a conformational study of the styrene and p-hydroxy-styrene molecules using higher level theory calculations. A thorough discussion of the influence of p-hydroxyl substituent on the results is provided, as well as a comparison between all the theories employed. Our outcomes show that the Coupled Cluster theory is the best choice to obtain accurate energy and geometry calculations on styrene and p-hydroxy-styrene molecules. The presence of the p-hydroxyl substituent stabilizes the coplanar form of the styrene molecule, but not enough to make it planar. We verified that the conversion from minimum energy structures of styrene and p-hydroxy-styrene molecules to the planar form is practically free. Calculations at CCSD(T)/cc-pVDZ//CCSD/cc-pVDZ and MP4(SDQ)/cc-pVTZ//CCSD/cc-pVDZ levels were able to adequately reproduce the experimental value of the energy barrier to conversion between the minimum and maximum energy structure of styrene molecule.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: GIAO-B3LYP Low Computational Cost Scaling Factor for 13C NMR Chemical Shifts Calculation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Computational and Theoretical Nanoscience

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Ultraviolet spectroscopy and Density of State for free Oseltamivir in Aqueous Solution by Computational Methods
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Ultraviolet spectroscopy and Density of State for free Oseltamivir in Aqueous Solution by Computational Methods

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Computational and Theoretical Nanoscience

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The oseltamivir molecule is used against the influenza flu. However, little is known about its electronic structure. The structure of free oseltamivir possesses a hydrophobic moiety, where the hydrophobic group is responsible for its poor oral absorption. The computational methods are used in this work to investigate the comportment of ultraviolet and density of state spectrum of the free oseltamivir by theoretical calculation. The Monte Carlo method shows that water-oseltamivir interaction is basically hydrophobic. Either oseltamivir ultraviolet or density of states could be useful as molecular fingerprint for aqueous system, because its major propagation medium is through the water.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Inclusion Complexation of Praziquantel and -Cyclodextrin, Combined Molecular Mechanic and Monte Carlo Simulation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Inclusion Complexation of Praziquantel and -Cyclodextrin, Combined Molecular Mechanic and Monte Carlo Simulation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Computational and Theoretical Nanoscience

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Antonio Maia de Jesus Chaves Neto

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: chistosomiasis is an infectious disease caused by parasitic worms. Large doses are necessary to achieve adequate concentrations at the destination due to low solubility of praziquantel. We use Monte Carlo simulations to generate structures of the water that will act as a solvent around praziquantel molecule with aim to study the formation of the solvation shells of the molecule after complexation into cyclodextrin. In this work it had shown an increased of the water number around praziquantel/β-cyclodextrin complexes in relation isolated praziquantel molecule. This increase of the water number is due to hydrophilic effect of the cyclodextrin molecule.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: 3-Ishwarone, a Rare Ishwarane Sesquiterpene from Peperomia scandens Ruiz
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: 3-Ishwarone, a Rare Ishwarane Sesquiterpene from Peperomia scandens Ruiz

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: 3-Ishwarone, (1), a sesquiterpene with a rare ishwarane skeleton, was isolated from Peperomia scandens Ruiz & Pavon (Piperaceae). Its structure was unambiguously determined by 1D- and 2D-NMR and infrared analyses, as well as by comparative theoretical studies which involved calculations of 13C-NMR chemical shifts, using the Density Functional Theory (DFT) with the mPW1PW91 hybrid functional and Pople's 6-31G(d) basis set, and of vibrational frequencies, using the B3LYP hybrid functional and triple ζ Dunning's correlation consistent basis set (cc-pVTZ), of (1) and three of its possible diastereomers, compounds 2-4.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: High Cost-Effectiveness Ratio: GIAO-MPW1PW91/6-31G(d)//MPW1PW91/6-31G(d) Scaling Factor for 13</sup>C Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Chemical Shifts Calculation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Computational and Theoretical Nanoscience

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper, we present a GIAO-HDFT universal scaling factor and a linear regression comparative study, in which we intent to investigate the ability of GIAO-MPW1PW91/6-31G(d) using optimized geometries at the same level of theory to achieve its high cost-effectiveness ratio. This level is computationally much less demanding than GIAO-B3LYP/cc-pVDZ//B3LYP/cc-pVDZ and GIAO-B3PW91/cc-pVDZ//B3PW91/cc-pVDZ, recently published for our research group. Despite the calculation approximations the chemical shifts calculated at the B3LYP/DGDZVP//B3LYP/DGDZVP using a simple relationship (δ scalc = 1 05. δ calc ? 1 22, where δ calc and δ scalc are the calculated and the linearly scaled values of the 13C chemical shifts, respectively) were able to yield MAD and RMS errors as small as those obtained with other GIAO-HDFT (B3LYP, OPBE, B3PW91) with bigger basis sets, such as 6-311 + G(2d,p) and cc-pVDZ and cc-pVTZ. Its high cost-effectiveness ratio scaling factor, as well as its successful applicability to practical problem, was confirmed. In conclusion, MPW1PW91/6-31G(d)//MPW1PW91/6-31G(d) linear regression obtained by using the experimental and the calculated data, is a very attractive tool as an alternative to more computationally demanding approaches, which are usually applied in order to achieve 13C NMR chemical shift calculations.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Bathysa australis Vanillic Acid (4-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid) Isolation by Countercurrent Chromatographic and Characterization by NMR 1H and 13C Experimental and Theoretical GIAO-B3PW91/cc-pVDZ//B3PW91/cc-pVDZ Chemical Shifts
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Bathysa australis Vanillic Acid (4-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid) Isolation by Countercurrent Chromatographic and Characterization by NMR 1H and 13C Experimental and Theoretical GIAO-B3PW91/cc-pVDZ//B3PW91/cc-pVDZ Chemical Shifts

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Computational and Theoretical Nanoscience

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: n this paper, we report the first time isolation of vanillic acid from Bathysa australis (Rubiaceae) using Countercurrent Chromatography (CCC) and its structural assignment by 1H and 13C NMR GIAO-B3PW91-cc-pVDZ and experimental data. We will also present a comparative study with González-Baro protocol in determining the chemical shifts of the vanillic acid. Although González-Baro vanillic acid chemical shifts calculations were carried out at the GIAO-B3LYP/6-311++G(d, p)//B3LYP/6-311++G(d, p) and the solvent effects were tacking into account using PCM model, GIAO-B3PW91-cc-pVDZ protocol presented lower MAD and RMS errors despite its lower computational efforts demanding. In conclusion, GIAO-B3PW91/cc-pVDZ//B3PW91/cc-pVDZ scal- ing factor is a very attractive tool as an alternative to more computationally demanding approaches, which are usually applied in order to achieve 1H and 13C NMR chemical shift calculations.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A Comparative Quantum Chemical Study of a Novel Synthetic Prenylated Chalcone: High Accuracy of NMR 13</sub>C GIAO-DFT Scaling Factor Calculations at the mPW91PW91/6-31 G(d) Level of Theory
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: A Comparative Quantum Chemical Study of a Novel Synthetic Prenylated Chalcone: High Accuracy of NMR 13</sub>C GIAO-DFT Scaling Factor Calculations at the mPW91PW91/6-31 G(d) Level of Theory

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Computational and Theoretical Nanoscience

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Chalcones are important intermediates for the synthesis of biologically active compounds such as flavonoid and isoflavonoid and their derivatives. In one recent work quantum-chemical calculations were used for a better understanding of the NMR properties as well as for an analysis of the geometrical parameters in (2E)-1-(3,4-dimethoxyphenyl)-3-{3-methoxy-4-[(3-methylbut-2-en-1-yl)oxy]phenyl} prop-2-en-1-one, a novel compound. investigate our scaling factor protocol for NMR 13C chemical shifts (δ) calculations at the mPW1PW91/6-31G(d)//mPW1PW91/6-31G(d) level of theory cost-effectiveness ratio (δ scal =?1.05 δ calc?1.22, where δ calc and δ scal are the calculated and the linearly scaled values of the 13C chemical shifts, respectively). Hence we will compared our scaled NMR 13C chemical shifts with the non scaled NMR 13C chemical shifts obtained at the GIAODFT and GIAO-HF level of theory using 6-311++G(d,p) basis set. Despite the calculation approximations, such as a truncated basis set, as well as the non-considered effects, such as solvent and rovibrational effects, the chemical shifts calculated at the mPW1PW91/6-31G(d)//mPW1PW91/6-31G(d) using a simple relationship (δ scalc = 1.05 δ calc ?1.22 where δ calc and δ scalc are the calculated and the linearly scaled values of the 13C chemical shifts, respectively) were able to yield MAD and RMS errors as small as those obtained with all DFT methods using bigger basis sets, 6-311++G(d,p).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Isolation, Identification, Relative Configuration and Conformational Analysis of Loliolide by GIAO-HDFT 1</sup>H and 13</sup>C NMR Chemical Shifts Calculations
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Isolation, Identification, Relative Configuration and Conformational Analysis of Loliolide by GIAO-HDFT 1</sup>H and 13</sup>C NMR Chemical Shifts Calculations

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: n this paper by combining GIAO-B3PW91/cc-pVDZ//B3PW91/cc-pVDZ chemical shifts (1H and 13C) calculation scaling factor protocols with NMR experimental data was supported the elucidation of the calculated NMR theoretical values obtained at GIAO-B3PW91/cc-pVDZ//B3PW91/cc-pVDZ scaling factor protocols show good correlations and high predictive power, which was confirmed by the statistical analysis of their calculated chemical shifts. The combination of 1H and 13C GIAO-B3PW91/cc-pVDZ//B3PW91/cc-pVDZ scaling factor protocols for stereostructure assignment has been shown here to give excellent results in terms of assigning stereochemistry with high and quantifiable confidence. Thus the present studies confirm the conclusion that the GIAO approach can reach high accuracy for the relative chemical shifts of natural products at a low cost. This is a promising fact for the use of calculated carbon and proton chemical shifts as a tool of conformational analysis for protein structure determination.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Monte Carlo Simulation and GIAO-HDFT NMR Chemical Shifts Calculations for Supporting the Identification of a Natural Terpenoid
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Monte Carlo Simulation and GIAO-HDFT NMR Chemical Shifts Calculations for Supporting the Identification of a Natural Terpenoid

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this paper by combining GIAO-B3PW91/cc-pVDZ//B3PW91/cc-pVDZ chemical shifts (1H and 13C) calculation scaling factor protocols with NMR experimental data was supported the elucidation of eugenol. We present also eugenol Monte Carlo conformational analysis. The calculated NMR theoretical values obtained at GIAO-B3PW91/cc-pVDZ//B3PW91/cc-pVDZ scaling factor protocols show good correlations and high predictive power, which was confirmed by the statistical analysis of their calculated chemical shifts. Thus the present studies confirm the conclusion that the GIAO approach can reach high accuracy for the relative chemical shifts of natural products at a low cost. This is a promising fact for the use of calculated carbon and proton chemical shifts as a tool of conformational analysis for protein structure determination.
